urls.title: Am I at Risk? | The Flood Hub
urls.description: 1 in 6 properties in England are at risk of flooding from rivers, sea and surface water, with many others susceptible to various sources of flooding. This number is only set to increase due to climate change, making the need for you as a property owner to check your own risk ever more important. A variety of information is available to help you check your flood risk, from online data maps to risk management information, giving you a head start to prepare your property for potential flooding.

urls.title: Flood Alert, Flood Warning and Severe Flood Warning ‚Äì What‚Äôs the difference? | Newground
urls.description: Recently, I saw a poll on Twitter set up to help the Environment Agency understand people‚Äôs interpretation of flood risk, which is one of the reasons I decided to write this blog. Out of the 1,199 people who voted on the poll, I was quite shocked to find that 51% of voters thought a Flood Alert meant that you were at a higher risk of flooding than a Flood Warning. This is NOT the case. Raising awareness of the flood alerts and warning system and what each stage means is key to educating people and
